itemDescription: Welsh rugby union and rugby league footballer

wikipedia_page.main: Alban Malcolm Davies (15 January 1926 – 27 February 2011) was a Welsh rugby union, and a professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1940s and 1950s. He played club level rugby union (RU) for Penarth RFC, Maesteg RFC (two spells), Cardiff RFC and Cardiff Athletic RFC, as a Wing, i.e. number 11 or 14, and representative level rugby league (RL) for Wales, and at club level for Leigh (Heritage №), Bradford Northern (two spells), and Leeds, as a wing, i.e. number 2 or 5.
